about_the_game:
Land of Symbiosis is an online cooperative or solo survival and action RPG game set in a procedural alien world. Explore biomes, battle bosses, customize and upgrade equipment. Gather resources to build and defend bases from creatures attracted by your technology's electromagnetic emissions.

Survive in a procedural alien world

To survive, you must navigate the diverse biomes of the planet, gathering resources, crafting tools, and upgrading your equipment to fend off the indigenous creatures. Drinking and eating are easily managed by your advanced suit technology. However, what is not easily managed is the creation of unlimited oxygen. You will need to find, gather, harvest and transform elements that will help your survival system keep you alive.

Use and fear electromagnetism

All of your technology generates electromagnetism: your suit, electrical systems, weapons, everything. Strangely, it appears to attract and provoke the creatures, making them hostile. Unfortunately, survival is impossible without your technology. Therefore, you must construct defenses to protect your bases from frequent raids.

Build and upgrade outposts

Gather resources to construct bases ranging from wooden planks to advanced technology! Your bases or outposts will aid you in managing defenses, electricity production, resource stocks, and everything else necessary for exploring and surviving this hostile world.

Find and defeat all bosses

It turns out that the scientists were not just there to collect plant samples. Some creatures appear to have been... modified? You could utilize their modifications to your advantage as you progress. Let's defeat them all, shall we?

Find and explore procedural underground bases

During your exploration, you will find what remains of the scientists' installations. They will take the form of procedural underground dungeons featuring many challenges and loot.

Context

You are an A.S.T.R.A., an elite fighter hired by a big company to protect scientists during their "study mission" on an alien planet, which seems to shelter indigenous life forms. While you were checking up on your capsule in space, an unknown electromagnetic impulse shut down every spacecraft's systems. Luckily, you are the only one who survived such a crash. Now, you must survive in this hostile environment and find a way home.
